abstract.text: Uses an interpolated lookup table to transform a 32-bit planar image.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. You’re responsible for filling out the

fields of this structure, and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
The number of values in the lookup table.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, one of the error codes in
Provide this function with a lookup table with any number of values, but with a minimum value of
. The function generates lookup values by linearly interpolating between the supplied values. The per-pixel conversion calculation is equivalent to the following:

code: float clippedPixel = MAX( MIN( src_pixel, maxFloat ), minFloat );    //clip src_pixel to be in range
float result = table[ index ] * ( 1.0f - fract ) + table[ index + 1] * fract;

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A type for a planar, 32-bits-per-channel, floating-point pixel.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
The vImage function completed without error.
Uses an interpolated lookup table to transform a 32-bit planar image.
Uses a lookup table to transform an 8-bit planar image to a 64-bit planar image.
Uses a lookup table to transform a 16-bit planar image.
Uses a lookup table to transform an 8-bit planar image to an unsigned 16-bit planar image.
Uses a lookup table to transform an 8-bit planar image to a 32-bit planar image.
Uses a lookup table to transform a 32-bit planar image to an 8-bit planar image.
A type for the number of pixels.
Uses a lookup table to transform an 8-bit planar image to an 8-bit planar image.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
